api/collaboration-api.title: Collaboration API
api/collaboration-api.description: Core interfaces for building and using collaboration adapters, plus base behaviors shared by Yjs/Liveblocks adapters.

api/converter-api.title: Converter API
api/converter-api.description: The Converter API provides format conversion between external formats (HTML, Markdown, LaTeX, Office HTML, Google Docs HTML, Notion HTML) and the Barocss Editor model format.

api/datastore-api.title: DataStore API
api/datastore-api.description: The DataStore API provides the core storage layer for managing nodes, transactions, and schema validation.

api/datastore-operations.title: DataStore Operations API
api/datastore-operations.description: DataStore operations are low-level operations that directly manipulate the DataStore with overlay and lock support. They are organized into logical classes.

api/dsl-api.title: DSL API
api/dsl-api.description: The DSL (Domain-Specific Language) API provides declarative template functions for building UI components. All templates defined with define() are automatically converted to components.

api/editor-core-api.title: Editor Core API
api/editor-core-api.description: The Editor Core API provides the main Editor class and related interfaces for managing editor state, commands, extensions, and events.

api/editor-view-dom-api.title: Editor View DOM API
api/editor-view-dom-api.description: The Editor View DOM API provides the EditorViewDOM class that connects the Editor to the DOM, handling rendering, event handling, and decorator management.

api/extensions-api.title: Extensions API
api/extensions-api.description: The Extensions API provides built-in extensions and helper functions for creating extension sets.

api/model-api.title: Model API
api/model-api.description: The Model API provides high-level model operations, transaction DSL, and operation definitions.

api/model-operation-dsl.title: Model Operation DSL API
api/model-operation-dsl.description: DSL (Domain-Specific Language) helpers provide a simple, declarative API for defining operations. They return { type, payload } objects that are used in transactions.

api/model-operations.title: Model Operations API
api/model-operations.description: Model operations are business logic implementations that use DataStore operations. They handle selection mapping, inverse operations for undo/redo, and transaction context.

api/operation-selection-guide.title: Operation Selection Guide
api/operation-selection-guide.description: This guide helps you choose the right operation for your needs based on the operation hierarchy.

api/operations-overview.title: Operations Overview
api/operations-overview.description: Operations in Barocss Editor are organized in three layers: DSL, Model, and DataStore. Understanding this hierarchy helps you choose the right operation for your needs.

api/renderer-dom-api.title: Renderer DOM API
api/renderer-dom-api.description: The Renderer DOM API provides the rendering layer that converts models to DOM using VNode reconciliation.

api/schema-api.title: Schema API
api/schema-api.description: The Schema API provides schema definition, validation, and management for document structure.

architecture/collaboration.title: @barocss/collaboration
architecture/collaboration.description: Core interfaces and base adapter for connecting Barocss DataStore to CRDT/OT backends. All concrete adapters (Yjs, Liveblocks) extend this package.

architecture/collaboration-liveblocks.title: @barocss/collaboration-liveblocks
architecture/collaboration-liveblocks.description: @barocss/collaboration-liveblocks connects DataStore to Liveblocks rooms for managed realtime collaboration.

architecture/collaboration-yjs.title: @barocss/collaboration-yjs
architecture/collaboration-yjs.description: @barocss/collaboration-yjs connects DataStore to Yjs (Y.Doc + provider) for CRDT-based realtime sync.

architecture/converter.title: @barocss/converter
architecture/converter.description: Pluggable document format converter for converting between external formats and the Barocss Editor model format.

architecture/datastore.title: @barocss/datastore
architecture/datastore.description: The DataStore package provides transactional, schema-aware node storage with a normalized data structure. It's the single source of truth for your document data.

architecture/devtool.title: @barocss/devtool
architecture/devtool.description: Development tools for Barocss Editor - visualize editor structure and events in real-time.

architecture/dom-observer.title: @barocss/dom-observer
architecture/dom-observer.description: DOM mutation observer with text change detection and collaborative editing support.

architecture/dsl.title: @barocss/dsl
architecture/dsl.description: The DSL package provides a template definition layer with functional DSL builders. It's how you define how your model data is rendered to the DOM.

architecture/editor-core.title: @barocss/editor-core
architecture/editor-core.description: The Editor-Core package provides the core editor logic: selection management, keybinding, context, and transaction orchestration. It's the central coordinator for all editor operations.

architecture/editor-view-dom.title: @barocss/editor-view-dom
architecture/editor-view-dom.description: The Editor-View-DOM package provides the view layer that connects the Editor to the DOM. It handles user input, selection synchronization, and triggers rendering.

architecture/extensions.title: @barocss/extensions
architecture/extensions.description: The Extensions package provides extension functionality for Barocss Editor. Extensions allow you to add new commands, keybindings, and features to the editor.

architecture/model.title: @barocss/model
architecture/model.description: The Model package provides high-level model operations and a transaction DSL for editing operations. It's the abstraction layer over DataStore operations.

architecture/overview.title: Architecture Overview
architecture/overview.description: Barocss Editor uses a model-first, DSL-first architecture. All operations work on a model, and everything (templates, marks, decorators, operations) is defined using DSL.

architecture/packages.title: Package Overview
architecture/packages.description: This document provides an overview of all Barocss Editor packages. For detailed information about each package, see the individual package documentation in the Packages section.

architecture/practical-examples.title: Practical Examples
architecture/practical-examples.description: This document shows how the different packages work together in real-world scenarios, demonstrating the complete architecture in action.

architecture/renderer-dom.title: @barocss/renderer-dom
architecture/renderer-dom.description: The Renderer-DOM package provides DOM rendering from model using templates with efficient reconciliation. It converts your model data into DOM elements.

architecture/schema.title: @barocss/schema
architecture/schema.description: The schema package defines the structure and validation rules for your documents. It's the foundation of Barocss Editor's type-safe document model.

architecture/shared.title: @barocss/shared
architecture/shared.description: Shared utilities and constants used across Barocss Editor packages.

architecture/text-analyzer.title: @barocss/text-analyzer
architecture/text-analyzer.description: Smart text change analyzer with LCP/LCS algorithm and selection bias for accurate text difference calculation.

basic-usage.title: Basic Usage
basic-usage.description: This guide walks you through creating a basic editor step by step, explaining each component and why it's needed.

concepts/decorators.title: Decorators
concepts/decorators.description: Decorators are temporary UI elements that don't affect the document model. They're a core feature of Editor View DOM (not an extension) and are used for visual feedback, highlights, comments, and other temporary overlays.

concepts/dsl-templates.title: DSL Templates
concepts/dsl-templates.description: DSL (Domain-Specific Language) templates define how your model data is rendered to the DOM. They are pure functions that make rendering predictable and testable.

concepts/editor-core.title: Editor Core
concepts/editor-core.description: Editor Core is the central coordinator of the Barocss editor. It manages commands, selection, keybindings, extensions, and provides the context that all editor operations need.

concepts/editor-view-dom.title: Editor View DOM
concepts/editor-view-dom.description: Editor View DOM (@barocss/editor-view-dom) is the view layer that connects the Editor to the DOM. It handles user input, selection synchronization, and triggers rendering.

concepts/rendering.title: Rendering
concepts/rendering.description: Rendering is the process of converting your model data into DOM elements using DSL templates. Barocss uses an efficient reconciliation algorithm similar to React.

concepts/schema-and-model.title: Schema & Model
concepts/schema-and-model.description: Barocss Editor uses a schema-first approach where you define the structure of your document, and all operations work on a model that conforms to that schema.

examples/basic-editor.title: Basic Editor Example
examples/basic-editor.description: A simple editor with paragraph and text formatting. This is the most basic example showing the minimal setup required.

examples/custom-extensions.title: Custom Extensions Example
examples/custom-extensions.description: This example shows how to create a custom extension that adds a "Insert Hello" command to the editor.

examples/decorators.title: Decorators Example
examples/decorators.description: This example demonstrates how to use decorators to add temporary UI elements like highlights, comments, and selection indicators.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: Use this page as the entry point into the Barocss Editor documentation.

guides/advanced-extensions.title: Advanced Extension Patterns
guides/advanced-extensions.description: This guide covers advanced patterns for building complex extensions, including multiple commands, command chaining, and integration with other editor features.

guides/custom-operations.title: Custom Operations Guide
guides/custom-operations.description: Operations are the atomic units of document modification. While extensions use operations through transactions, you can also create your own custom operations for domain-specific needs.

guides/decorator-guide.title: Decorator Guide
guides/decorator-guide.description: This guide explains how to implement and use decorators in Barocss Editor.

guides/extension-design.title: Extension Design Guide
guides/extension-design.description: Extensions are the primary way to add custom functionality to Barocss Editor. This guide explains how to create extensions step by step.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: Barocss Editor is a document editor built with a DSL-first, model-first architecture. Unlike traditional contenteditable-based editors, Barocss separates data from presentation and uses declarative DSL for everything.

quick-start.title: Quick Start
quick-start.description: Get up and running with Barocss Editor in minutes. This guide shows you the minimal setup to create a working editor.
